isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - DRIVE GEAR

step1.para: Mount assembly in a vise, pilot end up, and secure on the drive gear O.D. ( Figure 71). Vise used should be equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks to prevent damage to the gear teeth.

Use a punch and maul to relieve the drive gear bearing nut from the input shaft ( Figure 72). For models equipped with a snap ring to retain the bearing, remove the snap ring from the groove of the input shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 72. Relieve Drive Gear Bearing Nut From Input Shaft

note.para: A wear sleeve is pressed on the input shaft of models equipped with an oil seal in the drive gear bearing cover. DO NOT DAMAGE OR ATTEMPT TO REMOVE THE WEAR SLEEVE FROM THE INPUT SHAFT.

step1.para: Use a drive gear bearing nut remover to turn nut from the shaft, left-hand threads ( Figure 73).
Remove assembly from the vise. Use the rear face of the drive gear as a base and press the input shaft through the bearing, spacer and gear ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Press Input Shaft Through Bearing, Spacer and Gear

step1.para: If necessary, remove the snap ring from the drive gear ( inset, Figure 75). Check the bushing in the pocket of the input shaft and replace if worn or damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Remove Snap Ring From Drive Gear
